intro: Ditassa cipoensis, commonly known as the Cipoensis plant, is a flowering species native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
